reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Travelodge for 1 night. I recall staying at the same establishment when it was a Roadway Inn two years ago and that was surely depressing..... dated and musty! The new owners have done a complete 360' with renovations. The room was new and furnishings were new, comfortable bed and the AC was FRIGID! Just the way I like it on a hot summer’s night.
reviews.title: Surprised!

reviews.text: I stayed for one night with two of my children. The bedrooms were recently redone. They are beautiful and comfortable. On check in we were told that all though the bedrooms were redone they still had to get to the bathrooms (they just recently bought the hotel) so I was prepared for a subpar bathroom but found it was fine. Nothing wrong with the bathroom. The staff was very helpful in suggesting a great restaurant for dinner. The pool was a nice break from the rain we had while we were there. There is a nice playground out back and couple of charcoal grills for cooking. We really enjoyed the stay. My daughter was even able to work on a project for her summer classes as there is free WiFi and it worked well from our room. Like a previous guest mentioned, the one thing I would change was breakfast. There were two types of cold cereal with only whole milk. Very small, bite size muffins, donuts that had been frozen (still cold in the middle) and the make your own waffles. The waffles were great but one waffle maker for many people so it took a long time to get everyone through. I think they should add a second waffle maker and then have a better variety of bagels and bread with a toaster and maybe some fruit.
reviews.title: Great place, great price, nice people, breakfast not so good

reviews.text: The room was alot larger than I expected! The carpet was new and the beds were comfortable (and so was the recliner that I fell asleep in!). I did wish that it had a fridge in it, but no big deal.
reviews.title: Really nice...with one minor flaw...
Inquire within before driving by.
reviews.text: The kids enjoyed the small playground, and the indoor pool. The pool was not heated, and the spa/ hottub was empty, but again, no big deal.
The only flaw I saw was where the breakfast was served. The room was uncomfortably hot because of the lack of any fans or windows that can open.
reviews.title: the worse hotel I ever stayed in after being relocated from the other hotel they own because of a gas leak
